title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: How do busy bees avoid overheating from flying?
items.description: New measurements could help predict pollinators’ ability to withstand climate change

items.title: If AI discovers a drug, who gets the money?
items.description: Two intellectual property lawyers on why questions of AI inventorship and profit remain wide open

items.title: Giant viruses hijack their hosts’ protein factories
items.description: Researchers identify a complex that hands mimivirus control of protein synthesis in infected amoebae

items.title: A plant ‘vaccine’ takes on corn rootworm, a fearsome pest
items.description: Inoculating soil with pink microbes could help reduce the use of toxic insecticides.

items.title: Another NIH institute loses its director
items.description: Health department declines to renew Lindsey Criswell, head of arthritis institute, to another 5-year term

items.title: These scientists saw a future in public service—until Trump’s ‘massacre’ hit
items.description: Last year’s mass firings of “probationary” federal workers sent researchers’ lives into turmoil

items.title: EPA sidesteps science in repeal of U.S. greenhouse gas rules
items.description: Agency’s attempt to overturn 2009 “endangerment finding” appears headed for Supreme Court

items.title: A vanishing star births a black hole—without the fireworks
items.description: Failed supernova candidate points to a stealthy pathway of stellar collapse

items.title: Boosting origin of life theory, RNA comes close to copying itself
items.description: Some RNA molecules can create their own mirror images, suggesting similar molecules could have sparked life

items.title: NSF’s flagship fellowship program is rejecting applicants without peer review
items.description: Students seeking graduate research scholarships speculate that biology is being disfavored
